Label: Carthage
Scope note: Carthage was founded in circa 814BC and destroyed by Rome in 146BC. It controlled a wide territory (mostly by sea): at its greatest extent this included areas of the coast of North Africa, Southern Spain, Malta, Gozo, Sardinia, Corsica, Western Sicily and the Balearic Islands.

Label: Kingdom of Armenia
Scope note: Independent kingdom under the Orontid (circa 336-200BC) and Artaxiad (circa 190-1BC) dynasties.

Label: Kingdom of Pergamum
Scope note: Western Asia Minor kingdom centred on Pergamum circa 281-133BC

Label: Kingdom of Sophene
Scope note: Independent kingdom (circa 190-80BC) formerly part of the kingdom of Armenia and reabsorbed into that kingdom in the 80s BC.

Label: Koinon of Cyprus
Scope note: 1st century AD administrative district of Roman Cyprus

Label: Koinon of Syria
Scope note: The assembly of the Roman province of Syria, which celebrated games every five years in Antioch on the Orontes and issued coins in the name of the Koinon.
